column4: i tried what man xrandr said and it just game me the listing of what switches it accepts
What are you tyring to do?
i'm trying to run ubunto on virtualbox
sure, why not? someone else said xrandr, i didn't
xrandr is used to configure your video settings :)  Resolution size etc etc.
More specifically what is your problem then?  (Forget about xrandr)
Than we do need xrandr!!  funny funny.
in ubuntu run "xrandr -q" to see what the virtual card supports.
What is preventing you from doing that?
That is an odd size huh.  Do you want to switch your resolution or do you want me to help you install ubuntu to the HDD natively?
i want to run ubuntu in a vm, at 1024x600
Is that resolution listed in xrandr -q ??
Not looking good man :(.  I don't know how to change the hardware of a virtual machine :(.  That command lists what the graphics card is capable of.
